intro: Uva ovata, commonly known as the oval grape or Indian grape, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. The berries are usually green when unripe and turn red or black when mature, containing small, edible seeds.
